articles.description: Follow live text updates as Chelsea host Newcastle in the Premier League, plus watch BBC Radio 5 Live's Monday Night Club.
articles.title: Premier League: Chelsea v Newcastle - team news & build-up

articles.description: Cole Palmer is hugely influential as Chelsea beat Newcastle in the Premier League at Stamford Bridge.
articles.title: Palmer shines in Chelsea victory against Newcastle

articles.description: Britain's Emma Raducanu loses in straights sets to Belarusian world number two Aryna Sabalenka in the third round at Indian Wells.
articles.title: Indian Wells: Britain's Emma Raducanu beaten by second seed Aryna Sabalenka

articles.description: Manchester City defender Kyle Walker praises referee Michael Oliver for not "crumbling" and giving Liverpool a last-gasp penalty in Sunday's 1-1 draw.
articles.title: Walker praises ref Oliver for not 'crumbling' at Anfield

articles.description: Manchester City goalkeeper Ederson is set to miss up to four weeks with the muscle injury he sustained in Sunday's Premier League draw with Liverpool.
articles.title: Man City keeper Ederson to miss up to four weeks

articles.description: Racing's showpiece Cheltenham Festival starts on Tuesday with Irish trainer Willie Mullins set to dominate at the four-day meeting.
articles.title: Cheltenham Festival 2024: Preview as Willie Mullins runs State Man in Champion Hurdle

articles.description: Did Steve Borthwick produce his best win as England coach? Can Italy now avoid the Wooden Spoon? Is Le Garrec what France were missing?
articles.title: Six Nations talking points from round four

articles.description: Questions are being asked of England at the mid-point of the Ben Stokes-Brendon McCullum era, and now they must evolve to achieve the perfect finale, says Stephan Shemilt.
articles.title: 'Not the beginning of the end, but the end of the beginning'

articles.description: Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp was bemused by the decision not to award his side a late penalty in the 1-1 Premier League draw with Manchester City.
articles.title: 'What must you have for lunch if you think that's not a penalty?'

articles.description: British number one Cameron Norrie loses to Frenchman Gael Monfils in the third round at Indian Wells.
articles.title: Indian Wells: Britain's Cameron Norrie loses to Gael Monfils in third round
